visualization_prompt: Generate a polar spline chart showing synthetic quarterly revenue distribution across 12 sectors using bimodal cyclical trends with sector-specific clustering. Implement inverted polar layout with pane from 60° to 300°, innerSize 25%, and dynamic label positioning.

subtitle.text: Dual clusters: Emerging (μ=105M, σ=18M) vs Mature (μ=185M, σ=22M)

visualization_explanation: The dataset comprises 12 numerical values representing synthetic quarterly revenues across technology subsectors. Artificial data exhibits bimodal distribution with distinct clusters: emerging technologies (μ=105M, σ=18M) and mature sectors (μ=185M, σ=22M), simulating market adoption cycles. Values maintain financial plausibility through constrained ranges (75M-213M) and sector-specific allocation (e.g., Web3 showing peak values). The polar spline maximizes data density while maintaining readability through Tufte's negative space principles. Radial encoding leverages Cairo's angle-length perception for comparing cyclical patterns. Strategic color choice (#90ed7d) ensures accessibility while the 300° pane arc focuses attention on growth sectors. Statistical fidelity is maintained through cluster separation (Δμ=80M) that exceeds 3σ significance.
